main event: On 20th June 1949 at 02:02 in Los Alamos, New Mexico, a security inspector observed a round object, turning from green to orange-red before vanishing, traveling from west to east through zenith in 3 seconds.
interesting points: The observer was a security inspector at Los Alamos, meeting requirements for employment.
The object was self-luminous, had no projections, and left no trail.
It appeared directly overhead and disappeared as though extinguished.
The weather conditions and lighting at the time of sighting were reported to be good.
The observer mentioned that the object was not moving 'too fast'.
sighted object: round object turning from green to orange-red
